main_definition: Slight can refer to treating someone or something with disrespect, being careful about handling something delicate, a minor accident or injury, or an insulting remark.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Treat with disregard or slight attention
meanings_and_examples.example: He didn't give her the respect she deserved; he treated her with a slight.
The car had a slight scratch after bumping into a pole.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A polite or insulting remark made in response to an action
meanings_and_examples.example: When she tripped and fell, he said 'Oh, you're so clumsy.' - that was a slight.
